summary: This document is an email chain from October 9, 2019, within the U.S. Department of Justice regarding an unsolicited offer from Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property. The correspondence is being forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling.

persons.name: Arlan Ettinger
persons.context: He is the sender of an unsolicited letter offering his company's services to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property.

persons.name: Nathaniel Gamble II
persons.role: Official from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
persons.context: He advised that the correspondence from Arlan Ettinger be assigned to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for handling.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased individual whose property is the subject of the correspondence
persons.context: His property is the subject of an unsolicited offer from an auction house seeking to be retained for its disposition.

connections.description: Ettinger's company is seeking a potential business relationship to handle the disposition of Epstein's property.
Gamble directed the correspondence from Ettinger to the appropriate office (USAO-SDNY) for a legal response.

events.title: Email chain regarding disposition of Epstein's property
events.description: An internal DOJ email chain discusses how to respond to an unsolicited offer from Guernsey's Auctioneers to handle Jeffrey Epstein's property.

keyFacts: An auction house, Guernsey's, proactively offered its services to handle the disposition of Jeffrey Epstein's property after his death.
The U.S. Department of Justice internally discussed the appropriate, non-committal response to this unsolicited business offer.
The matter was assigned to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling, as advised by Nathaniel Gamble II from ODAG.
